name: September 11, The Day That Shook The World Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: At 8.45am, American Airlines flight 11 crashed into the north tower of the World Trade Center in New York City. What was the plane's intended destination?
questions.explanation:
Los Angeles.

	Flight 11 had ninety two people aboard.

questions.text: At 9.03am, flight 175 flew into the south tower of the World Trade Center. What was the airline?
questions.explanation:
United.

	United Airlines flight 175, en route from Boston to Los Angeles, was carrying 65 people.

questions.text: Where was President Bush when he was informed of the events unfolding?
questions.explanation:
Florida.

	The President was reading "My Pet Goat" to children in Sarasota, Florida. In an address to the school at 9:30am he told the audience, that the country had 'suffered an apparent terrorist attack'.

questions.text: What took place at 9.40am, for the first time in the history of the United States?
questions.correct: All air traffic was halted by the F.A.A.
options: The United Nations building in N.Y. was evacuated
questions.explanation:
All air traffic was halted by the F.A.A.

	All New York City area airports had already been shut down at 9.17am by the Federal Aviation Authority. One flight (known) was allowed because of a medical emergency in Miami. The flight, carrying urgent medical supplies, was from San Diego to Miami. It was escorted by two fighter jets.

questions.text: American Airlines flight 77 slammed into the Pentagon at 9.43am, causing extensive damage. How soon after this event was the White House evacuated?
questions.explanation:
Two minutes later.

	The White House was evacuated at 9.45am, the evacuation of the Pentagon having started immediately after the plane hit.

questions.text: The fourth highjacked plane was downed by the heroism of the passengers. Where did flight 93 crash?
questions.explanation:
Shanksville, Pennsylvania.

	United Airlines flight 93, crashed south east of Pittsburgh at 10.10am. Flight 93 was carrying 45 people.

questions.text: At 10.28am, with the world watching in horror and disbelief, the north tower of the World Trade Center collapsed from the top down, prompting an evacuation order to the area south of Canal Street. Who gave the evacuation order?
questions.explanation:
Mayor Giuliani.

	At a news conference that afternoon, Mayor Giuliani was asked about the number of deaths. He refused to speculate, saying it was 'more than any of us can bear.'

questions.text: During his tour of the devastated WTC site, what prompted President Bush to comment, 'I can hear you, the rest of the world hears you, and soon the people who knocked down these buildings will be hearing from all of us.' ?
questions.correct: A rescue worker yelled he couldn't hear him
options: Mayor Giuliani asked the President to repeat a statement
questions.explanation:
A rescue worker yelled he couldn't hear him.

	When someone in the crowd shouted that they couldn't hear him, a visibly emotional Mr. Bush gave his impromptu retort.

questions.text: Who was quoted as saying that he was not surprised the attack came, only at the extent of it?
questions.explanation:
Senator Bob Graham.

	Senator Graham, a Democrat from Florida, the head of the of the Senate Intelligence Comittee, made his statement at 4.20pm on the day of the attacks.

questions.text: At 5.20pm, another building collapsed at what was to become Ground Zero. Which building was it?
questions.explanation:
Number 7 World Trade Center.

	September 11, 2001 ended with a world in shock. As well as the thousands of dead, injured and missing, the sense of security and innocence of what had started as a gorgeous day, was suddenly gone. To the firefighters, police, E.M.S. workers and the victims... Ordinary heroes in extraordinary circumstances, or extraordinary heroes in ordinary circumstances, the terrorists decided that...
